website_summaries.verdict: Basic white wax citronella candles that can be purchased in bulk; great backups in case of emergencies.
pros: Candles can be used either in a lantern or on a stable surface
each will burn around nine hours
No overbearing scent and very little dripping
Can be easily packed to take along for camping, road trips, and other outings
cons: More appropriate for outdoor use because of the citronella
should not be burned in enclosed spaces

customer_reviews.title: Amazon fakes?
customer_reviews.text: On the right are UCO candles that I’ve been buying and using. On the left are the candles I received from the UCO amazon store. See anything weird? They appear to be heated up and squished cheap candles to try and fit my candle lantern. It’s obvious the wax will drip down the sides since they don’t fit flush at all. I thought I got duped by fakes but this is from UCO. Interesting. Sending back to amazon. Looks like I’ll keep buying them from a local outdoor store so I actually know what I’m getting.
customer_reviews.author: todd torres

customer_reviews.title: THEY DRIP
customer_reviews.text: These dripped down my UCO candle holder. It seems that they drip a little until the rounded part of the candle melts and flattens. At this time I can’t remove the candle from the UCO candle sleeve because of the melted wax. I don’t know yet if the wax dripped down on the inside of the candle sleeve but I suspect it did. That is very disappointing. Addendum: yeah, dripped all over. Was a pain getting the thing apart. Puts out a nice amount of light but the candle was everywhere is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow Polkadot 666

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy in bulk!
customer_reviews.text: Warning buying these candles in bulk Will be WARP or RECTANGLE Shaped. And that is NOT how UCO Candle Lanterns were meant for. Candles must be ROUND to fit and compress with the inside so it is tight. Buy a individual pack and you'll see the difference. I LoVe these candles but , "UCO needs to check their Quality Control for their BULK Candle production"
customer_reviews.author: William Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Best heating system ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of the single UCO Emergency Lanterns I put all 4 of them in this glass and metal enclosure and I love it! I do a lot of camping year round as a professional nature photographer. This system makes an excellent heating system for my enclosure. -18c outside around +5c inside. and the candles last 10 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Benard

customer_reviews.title: The quality is not what I thought it was!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this candle. The internal spring no longer pushes the candle up. Candle wax melts around the spring inside of the candle holder. I end up having to clean out most of the candle. Such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Buy 'em by the dozen!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect candles for the UCO candle lantern, no mess, no fuss. Hi heat trashed it while hanging in my Cherokee at work,,full sun on a black vehicle, I won't do that again,,,it is wax after all! (The spring pushed the candle up while in the "storage" position and had to install a new candle.) I put a small dab of essence oil on the candle before loading and it releases a pleasant odor when burning without affecting burn rates which last an entire weekend for my burning habits.
customer_reviews.author: greendohn

customer_reviews.title: Are these genuine UCO or fakes?
customer_reviews.text: The ones I received seem different than the ones I buy in stores. The shape is not as round and they drip a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Great when used with the UCO 9-hour candle lantern
customer_reviews.text: I keep mine ready for emergency situations. They work best when used in the UCO 9-hour candle lantern. Just basic candles on their own, but when used in the lantern they're performance is enhanced. Nice that the lantern makes them wind-proof, should you be using them outdoors and the lantern has a handle for hanging. I have found no defects, as I say they are basic candles and performs as expected. I would recommend them to anyone wanting or needing to be prepared should the grid go down or any other type of emergency situation. I highly recommend using them, for maximum performance use in the UCO Anodized Original Candle Lantern Kit -
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: The candle supplied with the Lantern has much to be desired
customer_reviews.text: The candle that is supplied with the UCO lantern has a wick that is ultra thin. The candle went out not long after it was lit. When I went to expose the wick from the wax so I could relight it, the wick broke off inside the candle. I could not expose the wick to relight it. This rendered the candle lantern useless on its maiden use.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Designed for "candle lamp" use.
customer_reviews.text: These are Designed for use with Candle Lamps. Found out AFTER purchased. They will still function, but a protected surface is required.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great "storm box" candles - long lasting and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Love these candles, we use them with the collapsible holder and they are a lifesaver when we get power outages. They burn clean and long, which is a huge difference over the $1 store type. Also they don't flood the room with perfume like the jar candles you get from the local CVS or Target. Great for camping as well, we take them everywhere as cheep insurance to have light when we need it.
customer_reviews.author: PA Shooter

customer_reviews.title: These candles arrived partially flattened from storage in too warm an environment.
customer_reviews.text: They do not fit in my Uco lantern. So I have a box of short squat out of round long- burning candles. I hope they replace that order.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Too fast
customer_reviews.text: If you need the uco candle this is ok . It burns too fast so it’s surprisingly a waste of money and time getting them. It is a decent warmth. The wax melts everywhere . That’s also gonna be a problem. It clogs the lantern and you have to chip it out. The u c o people need to get better quality candles which are longer burning and safer and don’t melt all over the place
customer_reviews.author: Heather Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 20 pack purchase and I have no issues with the operation of the candles, while they do show some signs of not being perfectly round they are not deformed in a way that doesn’t hinder the performance. Seems the candles settle a bit in the packaging causing them to have a somewhat flat on one side. I am carful to store the candles in a cooler area of the house to prevent further damage. I have had no issues with deforming candles once installed in the lantern or in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Real UCO candles,  nice and straight
customer_reviews.text: Despite of the bad reviews on the 20 count package, what I received was a box of real UCO candles and none showed any sign of deformation. I tested one in a lantern and it worked fine. I ordered the one sold and handled by amazon. I guess the trick is not to use any third party seller of disrepute.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: good candle lasts as advertised at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: they last nine hours as advertised, burn even, at a fair price or better - good camping complement with the UCO lamp. better outside the tent, tarp or canopy, as they put off a bit of heat (hey, it's a flame) - UCO lamp wil burn your fingers after use if not careful...
customer_reviews.author: schlitz

customer_reviews.title: 1 candle 1 hour tiny candle
customer_reviews.text: Ok Tiny little candels so 9 candles for 9 hours meaning 1 hour per candle so be careful because the description is not clear. I thought 1 candle burns fir 9 hours.
customer_reviews.author: jackie A

customer_reviews.title: Great candles!
customer_reviews.text: The candles are actually great. They really do burn that long! And they actually didn't melt in the 120+ degree heat in my bug out bag that I keep in my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha W.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tried these yet. I know that’s annoying when ppl review stuff they haven’t tried but these are TINY. I can’t imagine them lasting for very long. I bought them for emergency situations so I don’t want to test them out but maybe I’ll regret that decision:)
customer_reviews.author: RChambers

customer_reviews.title: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are
customer_reviews.text: All of the candles I recieved are flattened on both side like they got warm at one point. They worked just fine but is a little sketchy because of the flatten sides i imagine that could become a leak point. Overall though great candles.
customer_reviews.author: 0m3n

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These candles do their job just fine. There is one issue, if you have the glass up and burn the candle for longer than 30 minutes to 1 hour the candle will drip down into the body of the lantern. I have no issues if I raise the steel completely and lower the glass down into the lantern. Doing this helps keep the aluminum candle holder cool, preventing the wax melting below the rim of the metal shroud. In my opinion completely lowering the glass does not significantly raise the danger of causing a fire.
customer_reviews.author: joe caprara

customer_reviews.title: Surprise! They last even longer than stated!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a friend of mine who lives YEAR ROUND in a cabin in the woods that she built herself!! She lives without electricity, plumbing, etc. Truly roughing it! (Me? I'm a big city girl, LOL) In a thank you note she later wrote, she told me that when she received these from me this past Christmas (2014), she thought, oh yeah, sure....nine hours. Wellllll, to her surprise (and mine) she said they last much longer!!! Ten to 12 hours!!! WOW!!! So yes, I'm thrilled with this purchase. Great gift for the cabin owner!
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value for your money
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when I received this item because the candles were tiny. I do t feel like this was a good value for the money I spent. I feel like I could’ve done better at Walmart. I wouldn’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Amazon rampant with fake crap
customer_reviews.text: Not the same as what came with the Candlelier. Very disappointed as I bought 20.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: its candles..no mystery in that..is there???
customer_reviews.text: takes fire to make em work.like matches maybe. hope you didnt get confused there..make sure the hot end is on top..proably get someone to help ya iffn ya have trouble
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product good seller excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great products honest burn time no smell whatsoever which would be nice if they could make scented versions but good quality good seller excellent customer service absolutely no complaints can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: all arrived quickly in good shape
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used any yet but wax is strong and rated as a nine-hour candle like others I've got. Might get one of those wind-proof candle holders for them. Came neatly and carefully packaged - would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Combat Tom

customer_reviews.title: less expensive than beeswax
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the beeswax version due to longer burn time and slightly cleaner burning. These however are still great candles and are much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Murdock

customer_reviews.title: great for camping and emergency outages
customer_reviews.text: These candles are great for outdoors, for lanterns and for that time when electricity goes out. And yes, they burn for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: They last for 9 hours as claimed, a bit expensive and you are stuck with their ecosystem, no third party candles are available.
customer_reviews.author: Analysis Paralysis

customer_reviews.title: just don't expect it to heat the trailer up to any great degree.
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our Casita travel trailer, which is small at 17'. It adds just a bit of light and heat on colder evenings. Wife says it takes the cill off, but I say not really, just don't expect it to heat the trailer up to any great degree.
customer_reviews.author: H. T.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are great candles to have in case of a power outage. They last a long time and don't take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Peavey

customer_reviews.title: compact little candle
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are compact, yet long lasting candles. I can put them in mason jars during a power outage or use them in my new UCO lanterns.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Authentic UCO candles
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 20 pack and they came very quick and are as stated. I read other reviews stating that these are knockoffs, not at all the ones I received are UCO and are exactly as stated. Very happy with this purchase. I highly recommend these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marc de

customer_reviews.title: Awesome....
customer_reviews.text: Great to have around. I have at home, in the car and at the cabin. Well made and burn pretty well. I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality candle
customer_reviews.text: They arrived in good shape, none broken. Well packaged. Fair price. As described. Have not burned one, so cannot speak to the length of the burn,
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had the opportunity to let the candle go for 8 hours but it definitely seems to burn slow and does not drip.
customer_reviews.author: Mad City Gramma

customer_reviews.title: OEM candles
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money trying to save a few bucks on aftermarket candles! They will not work as flawlessly is OEM. If you are having problems with wax leak, make sure you have the candle piston installed on top candle spring. If you do not have these piston cabs UCO gear will provide them to you. They make all the difference in the functionality UCO Lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The candles burn slowly with a white light. Worth every penny. Seller A++++++-
customer_reviews.author: jan e.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my emergency supplies.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 candle lanterns for emergencies and this fits all of them. It's too pricy for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Burns for about 8 hours in the wind. Up to 9 in a tent. No smell. No drip.
customer_reviews.text: They burn just like the ones that came with it. I just feel that i should save more with a bulk order.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent candles
customer_reviews.text: Work amazing. Best deal for the price. Only thing I like more are the bees wax candles because they are more natural and burn a bit hotter.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky survival

customer_reviews.title: Made for Use with a Candle Lantern or Just in Case of a Power Outage
customer_reviews.text: If you have a candle lantern these are made exactly to fit. An extra supply with your candle lantern is really a necessity. These candles would also be great to just have around home in case of a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Desertguy

customer_reviews.title: old school light that works just great
customer_reviews.text: I still use the candle lantern in my tent. The flame is calming to look at and casts a nice mellow light. I think it helps dry the moisture out of the tent to but have no data to back that up. These candles burn a long time and leave little to no mess when they're done. The older I get the less I want to carry into the BWCA or backcountry trips so this lantern comes along in the saddlebags or trunk. If you appreciate candles this is a good way to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: My go to light while camping
customer_reviews.text: I use these candle every time I go camping. I have a canvas a-frame wall tent and hang this at night with my lantern. It lasts at least 9 hours and consumes the wax so that there isn't any mess.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Useful item important to have
customer_reviews.text: Great for prepping. Order early as it can take some time for delivery fulfillment.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: OK, they're candles. They burn long and fit just right in the candle lantern. Only bummer was I saw them for a few dollars cheaper in REI... No big.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Tyme

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy them again
customer_reviews.text: They do not burn as long as they say they only burn about 4
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Can't really say much about candles. UCO is a great company with great products. Have always been happy with their products. Will buy again when I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Ron J.

customer_reviews.title: Bummer they are overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for an unscented candle. I plan to make a mould from one and save money by pouring my own.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: They will burn a long when my batteries faild these helped. Saved my life until I was rescued.
customer_reviews.text: Used these uco candles in my triple uc o lantern vey dependable when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas nelsen

customer_reviews.title: great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Stores well and my test candle lasted longer than I was willing to test.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Eizenhafer

customer_reviews.title: Bright candles that last for hours
customer_reviews.text: These do burn well for several hours and are bright enough to light a room. I cannot attest to them burning for 9 hours, but i am completely happy with their performance. They are small enough to store anywhere but of adequate size for their intended use. They work well with the UCO candle lantern also sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TG1998

customer_reviews.title: These candles burned all night long.
customer_reviews.text: I used these candles for Christmas luminaries and they burned all night long. High quality, not any mess, they burn well and long.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S.

customer_reviews.title: Wax pools up, but very good value and reliable burning.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an antique candle lantern, they do not go out easily and burn very cleanly for petroleum candles, although they do have a tendency to drip and pool up wax at the top of the pillar, very efficient packaging and arrived almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: GREG ALAN LATOSYNSKI

customer_reviews.title: Love these and my UCO candle Lantern!
customer_reviews.text: These are the factory replacements for use in the Candle Lantern which is a great product. They have a long burn time when used in the lantern. To extend burn time I keep the wick trimmed when needed. I keep my extra candles in the box or carry in a plastic bag which I found to be important since I had one melt into the fabric of my backpack, after it sat in a closed up car in the summer heat.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P.

customer_reviews.title: Solid emergency candles
customer_reviews.text: Good emergency candles, I suggest getting 2 9-packs (3 3-candle packages in a cardboard box than the 20 pack (20 candles in one sorta unwieldy cardboard box).
customer_reviews.author: Tom Carey

customer_reviews.title: slow burning candles
customer_reviews.text: love then exactly like the ones we used to heat the igloos in Alaska cold weather training.
customer_reviews.author: micheal wessels

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Love my eco candle set up , when the power goes out . Hang one in the bathroom for the kids to see their way in
customer_reviews.author: Lance Endo

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Fits in the lantern great, burn time is 9 hours and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Bulk discount!
customer_reviews.text: The slow burn makes for less stuff in my pack. A real bonus on long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Beninya

customer_reviews.title: SMALLER THAN THE PICTURE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I must've misread the size because I looked at the pictures and these are tiny candles for the price. Very disappointed. Will likely return them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Candles
customer_reviews.text: For all you candle lantern fans out there: These candles, in the blue box, are the ONLY candles that work perfectly in the lantern. Even the ones that come in the plastic marked UCO don't burn properly and require fiddling around with constantly. I love my little lantern. I have used mine for decades.
customer_reviews.author: G. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Put them in hiking pack used one to see how long it burned and it had a full life of 9hours
customer_reviews.author: Jared Marks

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Well I don’t like to leave bad reviews about anything but I don’t have any choices. I contact the seller left massages didn’t get any response. Theses candles are so small about 2” and I have 16” lantern so tell me how would it look? And the price is to expensive for 3 2” candles. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amdad Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Great Candles! Arrived well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Great Candles! Arrived well packaged. I used them immediately, I would tell my friends to use them!
customer_reviews.author: K. Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: They’ll do
customer_reviews.text: Their as close to UCO candles as you can get in bulk and here comes the but. But their all misshaped maybe due to storage or improper moulding because of that they have a tendency to leak wax below the pusher plate and gum up the spring and base.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this knock off candle. Leaked out from my UCO lantern ( aluminum holder ). I'm glad it didn't catch on fire!
customer_reviews.author: A. Tom

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: As an avid outdoorsman and backpacker, I love using these candles in both my UCO original candle lantern and in my Coleman candle lantern. I got between 8 and 10.5 hours of burn time with each candle. Burns very clean and omits a white to light yellow light that is very adequate for lighting a small tent without totally destroying your night vision, not bad for reading either. Tried many different 9 hour candles, but so far these are my favorite. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Burns

customer_reviews.title: uco
customer_reviews.text: love my UCO candle lantern , leave one burning at night in the cabin as a night light
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fast service
customer_reviews.text: We use it as a small heater in our rv
customer_reviews.author: tom burriola

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Nine hour candles, why would you need them? These can be used as a convenient light source while camping (with the candle lantern), or as an emergency light source in your home. Either way, it's nice to have a variety of light sources. Plus, these produce a small amount of heat. That can be a good thing if you're camping in cool weather.
customer_reviews.author: SGHunter

customer_reviews.title: Love uco candles
customer_reviews.text: I have every up lantern and i love these candles.
customer_reviews.author: prince

customer_reviews.title: 9 Hours, I don't think so!
customer_reviews.text: Description says these burn 9 hours, my experience is half of 9 hours or less.
customer_reviews.author: Eightball

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these candles for many years in both nylon and canvas tents. In the past though I have always purchased the candles in the 3 packs. I was happy to discover this 20 pack on Amazon UNTIL I received them in the mail. The candles are oblong and NOT round. Is this the design now or is the result of bad storage? At this point I am not sure how they will burn in the lantern. Will they burn normally or will they drip all over the place and clog the lantern? I guess I may have to wait.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Different???
customer_reviews.text: These candles seem to drip more wax then the ones that came with my candolier. The wax deposits were a chore to boil and wipe off the holders. I had difficulty getting the spring out of the candolier holders because of the dripped wax. It makes me wonder if they are copycats of the UCO candles. Oh well (sigh) at least they fit the holders and burn.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Casatelli

customer_reviews.title: Great vaule
customer_reviews.text: They tend to last a little longer than advertised only thing I'm concerned with is how well they will store in hot temps. If they melt to much then they might not fit in the uco candler holders any more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent candle. 7hr length tops for the candle
customer_reviews.text: Family tested the length of time. 7 hours with four different candles in different rooms. No ceiling fan or “wind” of any kind. Simply sitting on a table. Could not get past 7 hours and a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Politician 2 U

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CANDLES
customer_reviews.text: Gave these to my brother with the lantern that they fit and my brother raved over how bright they were and how long they lasted. Seemed a bit pricey to me but after he told me about how good they were I felt much better about that.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie ParisTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with the UCO lantern. After trimming the wick to approx 3/16", these only burn for about half the claimed time. Definitely not a 9-hour candle, but certainly not a deal breaker. I'll try the beeswax and citronella to see if they're any better. Note: if you use the UCO lantern be prepared to dig melted wax out of the innards.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Beam

customer_reviews.title: don't buy in hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, only one candle out of my set was usable in my UCO. The temperature was in the 70's on delivery day and the postman laid the packager on its side, all the candles are too deformed for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best candles made.... 9 hours is what i got,. the white ones there is no doubt ..
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting & Clean Burning
customer_reviews.text: I liked being able to get more than a 3 pk, these work great in my lantern. They lasted a long time over 9 hrs. they burn clean no messy wax puddle even when not using in the lantern. I would call them Smokeless as the only time they did any smoking was when there was a heavy draft and not being used in the Lantern. I highly recommend for everything from using in your decorative displays to emergency / bug out bag. I know I will order more.
customer_reviews.author: cathyb4820

customer_reviews.title: Bent Out of Shape, Half are Useless
customer_reviews.text: I got a 20pk of 9-hour white and half of them are unusable because they're misshapen from heat and won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Screws And Marbles

customer_reviews.title: I used these after Hurricane Sandy and they worked well ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these after Hurricane Sandy and they worked well. When it's pitch black in your house, any amount of light is beneficial. I placed them on aluminum foil and had no wax drip. I stocked up just in case there's another power outage.
customer_reviews.author: bigkid43

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Missing wax on the sides. Less wax than the ones I've got otherplaces Edit: Because of the odd shape, the wax spills down the sides. Max 4 hour burn time. The ONLY thing this would be good for is melting down and reforming into the correct shape.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sylvestre

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent long clean burning candles that I use in our patio lanterns. I have already reordered
customer_reviews.author: Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Cost less, but don't burn as clean or evenly as some counterparts...
customer_reviews.text: They're great for the price. But they're vastly inferior to their REI Counterparts. They leave behind more wax and don't burn as evenly as others do...
customer_reviews.author: Jared B Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Candle produces plenty of light and seems to burn for ...
customer_reviews.text: Candle produces plenty of light and seems to burn for the specified 9 hours. These do not seem to produce any smells. I have them in both my hurricane kit and hypothermia kayak kit.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Candles are great! used them outdoors in lanterns to light porch during holiday season. Burned brightly for at least the time advertised, in spite of the extreme cold & wind in the CO mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: These things are great
customer_reviews.text: Candles made for the little lantern they go in. These are dense wax candles. They last for hours in the little collapsable lantern. I like to buy them to complete an order to get over the free shipping minimum. I store them in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Bassett

customer_reviews.title: These candles work great in our little camping lantern
customer_reviews.text: These candles work great in our little camping lantern. It provides just enough light to work without blinding everybody like most other lanterns do.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Martzen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good supply to last the early spring months when the temperature hovers around the freezing point......Jim
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for every backpacking trip, camp out and also power outages.
customer_reviews.text: Like these very much, worked for a power outage and burn at a long lasting rate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and ended up using them during Hurricane Sandy. I lit one and blew it out about 10 hours later and it still has a couple hours left in it. I would Highly recommend this item to anyone prepping for a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: mattmacs

customer_reviews.title: Best emergency/camping candle there is.
customer_reviews.text: Clean- and long-burning. Inexpensive, high melting point keeps them solid even in the trunk of my car in 100-degree temps. One of these and the lantern should be in everyone's emergency supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, Tested 1 candle for time and got not 9 hours, but 11 hours, Will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: rhs3502

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the expensive side
customer_reviews.text: Actually i do like the candels but they are way expensive to last only 9 hours and i have never had any actualy last that long. They make one that supposadly keeps the bugs away. I will try them next summer
customer_reviews.author: mainaird

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What I can say? Quality, same as all UCO products I've purchased over the years
customer_reviews.author: Happy1

customer_reviews.title: Best candles
customer_reviews.text: These candles are the best I have found and work wonderfully in the UCO candle lanterns. They are an easy burn and last quite awhile. They are so good you really don't need to trim them much if you use them multiple times (rather than one long burn). They also burn very evenly which is a must! They are shipped directly from UCO and and are well made. Can't say one bad thing about them.
customer_reviews.author: Tranquility

product_meta.title: UCO 9-Hour White Candles for UCO Candle Lanterns and Emergency Preparedness
product_meta.description: UCO 9-Hour White Candles for UCO Candle Lanterns and Emergency Preparedness are specially designed to fit the UCO Original Candle Lantern and the UCO Candlelier. Ideal for camping, hiking, and emergencies, no outdoor adventure or survival kit is complete without a stash of candles. Each candle measures 3.5 inches in height, and features a specially sized wick that maintains ideal flame height, optimizes burn time, and minimizes dripping and soot. The original White Wax 9-Hour Candle has a burn time of nine hours, and a high-melt temperature to minimize residue. Available in economical 3-Packs, 9-Packs, and bulk 20-Packs. Use with a UCO Candle Lantern indoors during power outages and emergencies, and outdoors for ambient camp light, or to warm a tent and reduce condensation.
feature_bullets: 9-hour white wax candles for use in UCO Candle Lanterns; ideal for camping, hiking, outdoor adventures, survival kits, and emergency preparedness
Each 3.5-inch candle burns for nine hours
High-melt temperature minimizes dripping and soot
Cotton wick is sized to maintain ideal flame height and optimize burn time
Includes 20 x 3.5-inch white wax candles for use with UCO Candle Lanterns to create an economical source of outdoor warmth and light
